‚ÄúTaste is earthy and very neutral. The buzz is up in your head (high effect), you feel tingly and at peace with yourself. Effects are felt olmost instantly, so there are no surprises. It lasts for about an hour and as fast the buzz comes in it gets out. In conclusion I would say a very potent strain that gives you a nice natural feel. A definite day smoke since you return to normal in a good hour.

It also made me c...‚Äù

‚ÄúThis past season, I grew one Himalayan Gold plant from feminized seed in my garden for personal medicine. Living in Southern Ontario, Canada it was started in early May and harvested at September end, yielding a respectable 210 grams of dried and cured bud. After a three month curing process, I baked a one gram cookie for a test. Himalayan Gold proves to be a quality strain with beneficial qualities. It is initially ...‚Äù

‚Äúsmoked this with some sativa kief & it was a really nice balance..semi-rush & energy/alertness from the kief came on strong & then a few minutes later, the soothing, relaxing goodness of indica tempers the rush into a clearheaded, yet heavy euphoria..the stress melts away as the buzz continues to build, almost as if they're in inverse proportions..after an insanely stressful & hectic day, while fighting a headache an...‚Äù
‚ÄúA personal favorite to grow and smoke, fantastic plant, nice yield and awesome smell.‚Äù

‚ÄúMy best friend fell into a lot of Himalayan Gold this year so I really got to enjoy it and take it in. Had a very natural hay" smell to it (probably due to curing reasons?) but had a great energetic kick to it. I used to blaze at the top of this mountain in my community and look at the little city lights as I smoked this with my best friend. It was also great for morning bakes too because it had no afterbake.‚Äù"
